channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What King of the Hill Can Teach Us
item.description: Hank Hill, in his own way, models conservative principle: fidelity to place and a willingness to make the best of a changing world.

item.title: Begun, the Gerrymandering Wars Have
item.description: Threats have been exchanged, and now we wait until someone pulls the trigger.

item.title: The Most Wonderful Time of the Year
item.description: Can you feel it? Football season is here.

item.title: Sen. Lindsey Graham says Trump will stand firm with Putin
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham said President Trump won't stand for a bad deal from Russian President Vladimir Putin when they meet in Alaska next week.

item.title: Trump says he'll turn D.C. from dangerous to safe
item.description: President Trump said D.C. will soon be "one of the safest" cities as his administration moves to handle violent crime in the nation's capital.

item.title: Can Teachers Opt Out? What Mahmoud v. Taylor Means for Educators
item.description: Public schools do not exist to validate adult identity or ideology.

item.title: Following the Trail of Death Comes for the Archbishop in Santa Fe
item.description: Willa Cather’s novel about faith, discovery, and calling, traced in this pretty city’s sights.

item.title: Wrist Slap For Man Who Attacked Pro-Lifers Proves The FACE Act Was Always A Lawfare Tool
item.description: Until Congress passes the FACE Act Repeal Act, pro-lifers are still vulnerable to further abuse -- both legal and physical.

item.title: Education Dept. Demands Receipts From Universities That Do Affirmative Action Under The Table
item.description: Data collection will allow the federal government to keep tabs on universities trying to hide their racial discrimination.
